intro: Monimiastrum globosum, commonly known as the globe-headed flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Linaceae and is characterized by its globular inflorescence, which gives it its common name. The plant features slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, typically arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the branches. Monimiastrum globosum is often found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
